feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows different daily wage calculation methods between leave policy and payroll settings. The payroll-side daily wage calculator takes precedence and overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions. The greyed-out display in leave policy indicates an intentional override is in effect.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required without automatic formula inheritance or synchronization.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, leading to potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks dynamic leap year handling in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts consistently produces slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors. When calculating End of Service (EOS) amounts, the system shows amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: Enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms are needed to ensure exact financial calculations for pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculations (Bayzat: AED 231,821.10 vs Manual: AED 252,485)
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculations involve complex service duration and daily wage formula parsing
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential need for more transparent gratuity calculation breakdown

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), potentially causing minor differences in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using precise day counting and leap year adjustments (dividing by 366 for leap years).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is intricate and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days vs expected 622 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculations. The system uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage, which differs from client's preferred (Basic × 12 / 365) calculation method.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation may include an extra day in total job tenure computation
known_issues.gap_statement: Inflexible daily wage calculation method that doesn't support alternative computation formulas

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage divisor is fixed according to policy settings, potentially causing perceived calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary based on monthly working days, causing inconsistent leave salary accrual reporting
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which may not be immediately obvious to users

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date.

known_issues.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a data synchronization issue between Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes mismatches in daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate deductions when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. Employees are experiencing salary deductions calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary as configured in the leave policy.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in handling nuanced leave policy configurations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The current system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
limitations.impact: High administrative overhead, potential for manual calculation errors

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula configured in leave policy. The leave policy formula becomes greyed out and non-editable.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings first, as these will take precedence for unpaid leave deductions.

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Day Counting for Leap Years
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Pro-Rated Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic + allowances) / 30, which may not always produce precise pro-rated amounts.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in End of Service calculations for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include that month's leave balance

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Opaque Gratuity Calculation Process
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear documentation explaining the precise gratuity calculation methodology, particularly for partial years and leap year adjustments.
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion and misinterpretation of calculation results

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Rigid Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows a fixed policy configuration that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for unique monthly variations or specific employee circumstances.

limitations.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Daily Wage
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage is calculated based on the number of working days in each month, which can vary (e.g., 20 working days in February)
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ month-to-month due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using different divisors and independent configurations
limitations.impact: Potential calculation inconsistencies and manual configuration required to align daily wage calculations

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is directly tied to the configured work week, including cases where all 7 days are marked as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ based on specific work week configuration

limitations.title: Limited Salary Proration Date Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have status changes.
limitations.impact: Users may experience duplicate or persistent payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove.

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays
limitations.impact: Precise daily wage depends on accurate working days configuration for each employee's country of residence

limitations.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation
limitations.impact: Prevents accurate retroactive recalculation of salary deductions when configuration changes occur

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions use a fixed 30.42 days divisor instead of calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Monthly Day Count for Unpaid Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations use actual calendar days for the month, which varies (e.g., 29 days in February during leap years).
limitations.impact: Accurate daily rate calculation requires precise month-specific day counting

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks dynamic salary calculation capabilities
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings are designed to take precedence for unpaid leave calculations, causing formula override
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings first; expect leave policy formula to be greyed out

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service amounts show slightly lower values than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculations manually and cross-check with expected pro-rated amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system and manual gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Complex calculation involving service duration tiers and daily wage formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance in the system if needed

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Calculation difference in gratuity amount due to day counting method
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses precise day counting method, including leap year adjustments (dividing by 366), which differs from manual calculation approaches
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Understand the system's specific methodology for calculating service duration, especially for periods above 5 years and partial years

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses predefined policy configuration for daily rate divisor, which may not match user's manual calculation expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's calculation logic before challenging the computed amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in leave salary accrual calculations across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, which recalculates daily rate based on monthly working days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use 'custom days' setting for leave encashments to maintain consistent daily wage calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between expected and system-calculated leave salary proration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or adjust calculation method to use consistent divisor

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week and confirm if all days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed instead of prorated amount for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic does not properly handle departure dates relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on days worked (daily rate = monthly salary / 30 * days worked)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automatic synchronization between leave management and payroll deduction systems

When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts consistently produces slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors. When calculating End of Service (EOS) amounts, the system shows amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculations (Bayzat: AED 231,821.10 vs Manual: AED 252,485)

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), potentially causing minor differences in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using precise day counting and leap year adjustments (dividing by 366 for leap years).

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days vs expected 622 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculations. The system uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage, which differs from client's preferred (Basic × 12 / 365) calculation method.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage divisor is fixed according to policy settings, potentially causing perceived calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.

claims_to_validate.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a data synchronization issue between Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes mismatches in daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. Employees are experiencing salary deductions calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary as configured in the leave policy.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The current system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator in payroll settings automatically overrides the formula configured in leave policy. The leave policy formula becomes greyed out and non-editable.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Day Counting for Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic + allowances) / 30, which may not always produce precise pro-rated amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled

claims_to_validate.title: Opaque Gratuity Calculation Process
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform lacks clear documentation explaining the precise gratuity calculation methodology, particularly for partial years and leap year adjustments.

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Rigid Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows a fixed policy configuration that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Daily Wage

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Salary Proration Date Handling

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have status changes.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Day Count for Unpaid Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations use actual calendar days for the month, which varies (e.g., 29 days in February during leap years).
